snippet: Joshua Wong, the student leader whose early calls to protest helped set off a monthslong confrontation, says he knows his hunger strike is aimed at achieving “the impossible.”
abstract: Joshua Wong, Hong Kong pro-democracy protester, enters fourth day of hunger strike; Wong says he plans to continue the strike until city's leader Leung Chunying agrees to public talks with him.

byline.original: By CHRIS BUCKLEY and ALAN WONG

lead_paragraph: Joshua Wong, the student leader whose early calls to protest helped set off a monthslong confrontation, says he knows his hunger strike is aimed at achieving “the impossible.”

headline.main: A Frail Face Becomes a Defiant Focus of Hong Kong’s Waning Protest Movement
headline.print_headline: A Frail Face Becomes a Defiant Focus of Hong Kong’s Waning Protest Movement
